Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: GFBPA
Reviews.Content: Very good, very well located, clean, beautiful....almost excellent. the only thing was staying in 4th floor with elevator broken....

Reviews.Title: “Location and style”
Reviews.Author: Jayjay2020
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel at a nice location. I stayed for a weekend with a friend traveling to Amsterdam and she liked it very much, too. Small rooms but no reason to take away comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times!”
Reviews.Author: ODKRYWCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in March and were very happy all around. We stayed in an upper floor canal view room and enjoyed watching the city passing by. The hotel is in a perfect location on the Herengracht canal in a more quiet area of the city, near the Jordaan and the "9 Streets" but still very close to all the sights (7-10 minutes walking to the Dam Square). There are many great cafes, restaurants and boutique shops in the neighborhood, plus one of the absolute best beer pubs in all of Amsterdam just down the block ('t Arendsnest, with over 30 specially selected Dutch and Belgian beers on tap, more in bottle). We found the staff to be really helpful and friendly and you could tell they take pride in this family owned hotel which is modern and tastefully done. This is a converted old canal building, and while some may feel the rooms are small, for us they were more than adequate and a good value for our use as a home base in Amsterdam. I would not hesitate to stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: H4y13y
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 571 room quite small but clean, lovely bathroom with amazing shower. Bed was comfortable to but did seem to roll in to the middle for some reason. Location was brilliant, quiet area but near enough to everything you need. I must say u need to have your walking shoes ready though not because the hotel is far away you just seem to walk and walk! The only con was having to pay extra for breakfast I think this should be included in the price as the hotel isn't that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location + Small Rooms = A Decent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Carrie R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the times, Feb 2012, for EUR 119 per night. We paid EUR 10 per night to 'upgrade' to a room overlooking the canal. We booked with the hotel directly and got the best rate available. Pros: Excellent location, close to the train station, Jordaan, Red Light and Nine Streets Modern Bathrooms look to be recently refurbished, great shower and towels. Nice cafe in bottom of hotel, with complimentary coffee, tea. (Double check - the hotel tried to charge our friends for a few coffees. We were never really sure if they were free but they didn't charge us.) Cons: The bedroom in our room was so small you could barely walk between the wall and the end of the bed. Our room 272 overlooked the canal, but the windows were full of condensation the entire time and the window was at feet level - not much of a view and I suspect the noisiest room in the hotel, right above the front door, cafe and lobby. Generally Noisy Walls are thin enough to hear people talking, not to mention the maid banging around her hoover in the other room. The bed was uncomfortable. Sloping towards the middle and hurt our backs. We found the service to be aloof at best. They did just enough to get by, but never went above and beyond. Barely got one woman's attention to allow us to purchase river cruise tickets. Room Tip: Don't stay in or upgrade to room 272! Cafe Baton was a lovely for breakfast or lunch and is just 1 block north of the hotel across the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Leopoldino M C
Reviews.Content: Gostei dos funcionÃ¡rios, muito educados, o quarto com vista para o canal Ã© uma delÃ­cia! O cafÃ© da manhÃ£ Ã© continental, mas serve bem aos propÃ³sitos da viagem e nos alimenta bem. Entretanto, que localizaÃ§Ã£o fantÃ¡stica! HÃ¡ 10 minutos da estaÃ§Ã£o central dÃ¡ para vir com as malas andando... O hotel Ã© bem limpo, bem como o banheiro. Eu recomendo. IÂ´ve liked the hotel a lot! The staff is very polite. The room with the canal view is awesome! The breakfast is continental style but it will suffice to feed us well. Great location jut 10 minutes walk from the station centraal (yes, centraal). I have even made a drawing in their guestbook, which I have taken a picture. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “mojobythesea”
Reviews.Author: mojobythesea
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night mid december. Double room more like an apartment. Bed very comfortable,bathroom modern and spotless. Staff friendly and informative. Great location all of which made visit very enjoyable. Highly recommended.Definately would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Awful !”
Reviews.Author: SussexHoney
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as the pictures of the bedrooms looked good, and we could have a city view which we thought would be great being that it was New Year. Well the room we was given was filthy it had not been cleaned from the last guests, it was not big enough to swing a cat in, and the view of the city was a back yard, when we went back to reception to complain we were told that a city view did not mean 'city' view and probably this should be altered in their hotel details, really! I am sure guests would probably love looking at a yard from their bedroom window. The staff had the worse attitude I have every come across in a hotel. We walked out with disgust and found a wonderful hotel: Sint Nicolaas, Spuistraat 1a. which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, small rooms, adequate continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Tracy M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Times Hotel a couple of times now, and have overall enjoyed my stay. The rooms have been clean and the breakfast has been adequate. I think it is in a great, central location, and that you pay for that (it's not a cheap hotel, but good value due to location). However, be aware that the lift does not get you to all rooms, and some are awkward to get to (steep, narrow stairs). There are no hairdryers in the rooms, BUT the staff on front-desk are very helpful and will lend you one (always handy to know before you get out fo the shower and have to take the long trek downstairs!). I travelled there on business, and would go back as a tourist (if I could get a deal on the room)!

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything - bring your walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: Kericardiff
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. We didn't need trams as we walked 2 everything we wanted 2 see including the Ann Frank House, the Palace, Dam Square, the Museums and the shops! The hotel is small and modern but still retains the original charm. Reception staff are really helpful and friendly. Rooms are small but clean with nice towels and toilletries. It would have had a 5 star from us but (a) no tea / coffee facilities in the room, (b) bit pricey 4 what you get and (c) breakfast not included (10 euros 4 continental breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms with paper walls!”
Reviews.Author: Maya34
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights when i was travelling for business purposes. My company booked for me so I had no other choice. If it were up to me, i would have stayed elsewhere. The room was so small that it was hard to move around. Especially the distance between the bed and the wall bearly allowed one person to pass. There was no desk in the room to put your computer on. The walls were so thin that you could hear the TV set in the next room very clearly. The only nice thing about the room was the modern bathroom which was surprisingly big for such a small room. The hotel had a nice exterior and had a very promising look at the first glance. But unfortunately this changes once you step inside the hotel and the room. The service level is not so good either. When i had a complaint about the noise coming from the adjacent room, they asked me to knock on the door to ask for silence. I don't want to be unfair but I am normally used to staying in small rooms, however this is way beyond small where it is hard to turn around and breathe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: Me and the mrs stayed here for 2 nights in August, the receptionists were very helpful in giving us directions to all the tourists spots, the rooms were small but cosy, with a resonable sized bathroom and very good shower, the towels and sheets were changed daily too. the Anne Frank house is a 5 min walk which is a must (book tickets online to avoid the ques) and there are some lovely cafes along the canal serving brilliant coffee, avoid the tourists traps where a coffee or beer can set you back 5/6 euros each. all in all this hotel was clean, tidy, well ran and most importantly in a great location. we found the price was reasonable, 90 euros a night, not bad for a capital city. an ideal hotel for couples looking for a weekend getaway

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull location”
Reviews.Author: GulayKonal
Reviews.Content: it is near the red light street . Especially i lke the decoration of the rooms. Ä° am planning to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: 3Lizzie
Reviews.Content: initially I was told the price would be 129 euros for 2 of us plus my 10 year old son. I was then told it would be an additional 35 Euros for the extra bed - which means that it was 164E per night plys taxes. The room was small and then even smaller with an extra bed! Nothing is complimentary - breakfast is 10E each - not worth it! and there is no free tea or coffee making facilities in the room - and presumably if you want one downstairs - you pay for it. There is nothing really really redeeming about this hotel - except location - but there are other hotels on the same canal which might be more value for money. service and staff okay but not outstanding or especially nice.

Reviews.Title: “clean and trendy”
Reviews.Author: norman44
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the weekend and liked it very much. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was just what we needed: clean, good beds, modern design and quiet. The hotel is located at one of the nicest Amsterdam canals and on just ten minutes walking distance from the Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “quirky - friendly. It's Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: swixo
Reviews.Content: The Times Hotel is a favorite, but only when on vacation. The rooms are smallish- but nice. The hallways are narrow and go all over. Has elevator. Bathrooms vary in size per room, each is unique. Has A/C, and free internet. Beware - this hotel does NOT offer laundry service - so I cannot recommend it for business travellers who need that (like me). On vacation its superb. Breakfast is included. Coffee from an espresso machine in lobby available. Friendly staff helps you plan your day. It's a few blocks from central station and Dam Sq. Right on Herengracht canal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTraveler09
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Amsterdam many times and have stayed at numerous hotels. The only good thing about this hotel is its location, which is prime. The rooms are terrible and some of the smallest that I have seen. For the price, you are better off staying somewhere else. The beds are some of the worst that I have encountered - they feel like you are sleeping in a hammock - as you literally sink into them. Amsterdam has many options - don't make the mistake that we did.

Reviews.Title: “The motel 6 of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: 43jan
Reviews.Content: Rooms are for a minimalist. No coffee maker in room. No face cloths in bathroom. Phone and desk w/ lamp are all the niceties you get. Room cleaning did not include replacing the plastic drinking glasses, providing a new supply of shampoo or returning a coffee cup to the reception area. Excellent location but with canal side rooms there is a bar that stays noisy late on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, when they have an offer”
Reviews.Author: ski-fanatic-73
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is at a perfect location if you want to stay in the city center. The rooms we could chose of were very small; you could hardly turn around. In the room everything worked so that is fine. We have booked a 2 person bed, but all the rooms they had left upon arrival were 2 single beds; "you can move them together" --- ya, thanks. O ya, if you come from a country where walls are from concrete: as this hotel is at the canals in Amsterdam; buildings are old there, back in the days walls were not that thick: if you have a couple who is very much in love in the room next to you, you are likely to be able to hear it. The person (there was always just one) working there was friendly and helpful; but not at a 4 star hotel level. I could recommend this hotel when you want to be in the city center; you will not spend great times in your hotel room and when the price is at the same level as comparable hotel offers; but not more!

Reviews.Title: “BRING YOUR OWN SHEETS”
Reviews.Author: BritChikOhio
Reviews.Content: I was interested in staying at the Times Hotel for two reasons - location and free wi-fi. Location wise I was happy - it's very close to everything (Nine Streets / Park / Station) and far enough away from the noisy red light district, but that's the only plus. I didn't see other rooms - but I had a City Twin Room (room 153) Firstly the sheets on the bed where really scratchy and polyester based and made me sweat all night - I felt like I was in a damp sleeping bag, and the awful single comforter/duvet was FOAM filled. No light down feathers here - not a good nights sleep at all. I had to go and buy pillowcases and sheets for my second nights stay. The TV remote was missing and reception didn't seem to care. They just said that someone most likely took it with them and that this happens a lot. Not my problem - but it became mine as we had no remote until they thought of a brilliant plan to steal one for me from another room!! Also internet was NOT available in the whole hotel as advertised - only in the reception it seems. I was in a room only 10-20 yards from reception and could not access it on my Mac. Again - this was made my problem and not theirs.... It wasn't a cheap hotel - but I felt I got cheap (hostel) service. I doubt very much I will stay there again - but do intend on visiting Amsterdam on a monthly basis - so they have lost business there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: NBlick
Reviews.Content: The Times hotel is located in the Jordaan district of Amsterdam, a beautiful area close enough to the night life and tourist spots (literally round the corner from the Anne Frank House) without all the noise. The hotel was easy to get to (a ten minute walk from Centraal station). The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and had a great feature wall of a Dutch master. There was even a lift, a rarity in the tiny Amsterdam hotels. Overall a very pleasant hotel, I'd definitely stay again if I ever go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; great for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: GardenerCook
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - fantastic quiet canalside location, a short walk from stylish shops, fabulous resaturants & Anne Frank Huis. The rooms are small & can be dark but are well equipped & fit for purpose. Excellent breakfast in a vibrantly decorated room looking over the canal. Great staff - nothing too much trouble. Warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RocketHerts
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week end break in Amsterdam. The Times Hotel has one of the best quad rooms I have every stayed in with beautiful views across the canal. Very easy going helpful staff and great location for either sight seeing, walking, art galliers or night life.....anything really.... very very good....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little place!!”
Reviews.Author: andi94
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a spontaneous holiday that landed me in Amsterdam. They actually had one room available when we inquired and I am so happy that they did. This hotel is clean, comfortable and has an awesome staff. The lady who checked us in gave us an attic room with a canal view. It had a tall slanted ceiling and a bed that was comfortable. There was not much space (it was small) but the room is clean and it is fun to experience the quirky little European attics. The bathroom was quite nice - very recently redone with a large shower and they offered shampoos and lotions and such. There was not a hairdryer in the bathroom. This hotel also has wifi (though the connection that on the fifth floor is not great) and several English channels on the flat screen tv. Wine, beer, and other drinks are available for purchase in the Lobby and it was nice to enjoy a glass of wine in the breakfast area whilst using the internet. We paid 89 euros for the room and were quite pleased. The hotel is located in the Joordan district of Amsterdam which was my favorite because it is quiet, centrally located, and full of little restaurants. The only downside was that the linens were a bit rougher than I would normally expect and the slanted ceiling is a bit dangerous when you are laying on the bed because you can easily knock your head on it (though this was likely just our attic room - i doubt you would have that issue in another room). Also, you must pay for breakfast (though there were some leftover pastries that the staff told us we could help ourselves to so this was not an issue). Overall, it was a great stay and I would definitely return to this hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel, heating (in winter) was insufficient”
Reviews.Author: vcchicago
Reviews.Content: The Times Hotel is well located by a canal in central western Amsterdam. Staff is very friendly, the hotel has been recently renovated and features a Van Gogh print in each room. I was in the top most (5th floor) and felt that the heating for the room was insufficient. Also, the hotel does offer free wireless internet (good) but you cannot receive it above floor 2 (bad!) They have a breakfast sprad but I never did try it. Rooms are small-ish, but well appointed. The lifts are good, but do not serve the basement and the fifth floors. Again, staff was very friendly and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY Hotel! And NO rude receptionists here!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth51
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Times Hotel a few times for my business meetings,its a small lovely hotel in the quiet part of the center, Its clean, has nicely decorated design rooms and great staff! I feel the urge to stick up for the receptionist who is called rude in the review . I was there having breakfast with my colleague when this man came down and started complaing OUT LOUD about "the box" he was staying in (referring to his room) and WHY "he" had to pay for the coffee. If he stayed in the hotel a few times,like he writes, he must know the rooms aren't very spacious ( but large enough for me,and its an old canal house so you can expect that) and the coffee is not complimentary..This man was making a scene about nothing and he just wouldnt shut up. It wasnt very proffesional to call a guest annoying, but we,and all the other guests who were having breakfast, could completely understand why she said that and it made us smile to.. WE AGREED! ugh..some people..we hope he is not there when we are! Times Hotel, We see you soon! Elisabeth

Reviews.Title: “Rude Receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Manderiny
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much and have stayed here a number of times while on business, good location, clean and a nice place to stay, until unfortunatley I had my head bitten off by the large brunette receptionist who even refused to give me her name. I only enquired about a coffee that over the past stays is usualy put onto the room bill, she accused me of shouting I didnt even raise my voice, told me a paying guest that I was annoying and she was done with me (very eratic woman!). Of all the hotels ive stayed in including this one which has been a number of times, I have never ever been spoken to like this by a member of staff. I did complain to the manager who refunded me a nights stay and i ended up booking into another hotel out of principal because of the sheer rudeness of this receptionist, if that was my hotel no doubt she would have gone there and then. i would recommend this place but not all the time she is working there.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, great location, nice breakfast. No fuss”
Reviews.Author: SeanPTF
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the 'reviews' are negative! The location is great, right on the canal, within walking distance of the (actual) city centre but far enough to be peaceful. The room was clean, albeit a bit cramped but who cares? The en-suite was perfect, and there's a safe to store valuables. There were 3 staff on reception. One was a lovely, very busty lady who was helpful. People are moaning about their service but there isn't really that much for them to do? The hotel is pretty self-sufficient so i'm at a loss as to how some reviews seem to nit-pick something wrong just for a fuss. The only thing i thought is that at Â£80 for a twin room it was pricey but on second thoughts you pay for the location, and it is in a big city so its fair enough. Its a lovely little quaint hotel out of harms way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: djw77
Reviews.Content: Very quirky hotel in a great location. Close enough to the main bars that they're walking distance, but location is actually very quiet. Our room was small but clean and nicely decorated. Friends stayed in a nearby hotel and paid double for an awful room so I would definitely recommend this hotel. We had a city view room but our only view was the wall opposite and there was only one mirror in the bathroom which was a bit of a pain, but that was the only downside.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: DGR1968
Reviews.Content: All the reviews here are spot on. Great location. Quirky hotel (our room was a big studio for 4), horrible access for disabled, clean, etc. Don't hesitate to stay here if you get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Warning for disabled travellers”
Reviews.Author: Mary5474
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good particularly if you are staying one night. The hotel website and direct e-mail to the hotel were VERY misleading for disabled people. The website says that there is a ground floor room near the reception for wheelchair users. This is now a kitchen! Response to my e-mail assured me that wheelchair users are â€˜well catered forâ€™. As a wheelchair user with some mobility I would warn anyone wanting to use this hotel that it isnâ€™t good for wheelchair users. Yes, there is a lift and really thatâ€™s about it. When we reached the 4th floor we had to turn a very tight corner with a large step down into a small corridor. We explained that this would be a problem and were moved to another room, but it really wasnâ€™t easy to manage- very difficult to manoeuvre the chair. Lovely bathroom but couldnâ€™t get the chair in! For anyone visiting this hotel note that the carpets are very dirty throughout and the breakfast is certainly not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Cute”
Reviews.Author: joshuag
Reviews.Content: I booked this after looking through trip advisor for a decent hotel in the dam. The room was incredibly small and had no view other than looking in a void. It was decorated beautifully although the giant Van Gogh wall print does do your head in after a while (sorry Holland) and top quality fixtures/fittings. The bed was very soft which wasnt great if you have a bad back like me. It was a little noisey too as it was situated by the lift and you could hear it going all the time and also the loud closing of doors. Id advise you to go out for breakfast as the hotel does a very basic buffet with no hot food, even the toaster was broken. Service was ok, i didnt find it that friendly considering the money i was paying. This is a nice boutique hotel but at 150 euros a night for basic room its a little overpriced. Modern hotels arent few and far between anymore so you might be able to find a better deal elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with Flair”
Reviews.Author: 0Venera0
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on location and price. It's located in Centrum, on a canal, and within walking distance of all of the things we wanted to see again in Amsterdam. Furthermore, we prefer quirky hotels with personalities to sterile, chain hotels. This hotel definitely has personality. From the red and white downstairs lobby/check-in area/breakfast nook, to the half-flights of stair separating the rooms, to the rooms, some of which have murals recreating famous paintings on the wall. The staff was very friendly, offering us directions, suggestions, making us cappucinos, and even lending us an umbrella one rainy night. The rooms are small by US standards, and average by European standards. The double bed was just two twins pushed together, which tends to be the norm in Europe (unfortunately). The bathroom was quite small, but was designed so cleverly and so well, that it was fun to use. The room and bathroom were immaculate, totally spotless and quite new looking. The included breakfast doesn't have a lot of choices, you may be better off getting something at a nearby cafe. You can also book a room for a half-day (i.e., during a long layover) which is great. You can arrive early in the morning, crash for a few hours, shower, then wander about Amsterdam before your evening flight. We were so pleased with our first day, that we have used The Times Hotel in this fashion several times. We paid around $90 USD for our rooms, which was a great bargain for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “a quirky little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diti
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 days in Amsterdam and found the Times Hotel excellent. A 12 minutes walk from Central station. Very well situated. On Herrencracht canal, which is beautiful and very peaceful. Small rooms, comfortable bed, very well appointed bathroom, adequet breakfast (â‚¬10) We would certainly go back. A visit at this time of year to Keukenhof and the bulb and flower fields is well wotrhwhile and we also enjoyed a canal dinner cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: susie125
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews here. I thought the hotel ticked all the right boxes... excellent location, great friendly staff, reasonably priced and clean. We stayed on the fourth floor with lovely views of the canal. The room was small but all you needed for a weekend break. The shower was clean and nicely designed. I loved the fact that it was set in an old building but that the interior had a modern funky feel - leaving it cosy yet stylish. The old masters wallpaper gave it an added cheeky and fun flavour. We paid 180 euro (approx Â£133) for two nights which I think is a bargain considering the location etc. I don't generally post on this site because I find the reviews none representative (usually a forum for those who want to complain) but I couldn't let those people considering this excellent hotel miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: arcinicola
Reviews.Content: We spent a week end in this hotel. It is very well located in central Amsterdam, but be carefull. Service is at the minimum level, more or less like in a hostel. Our room was full of mosquitos... for 200 USD per night I expected much more

Reviews.Title: “dirty carpets..”
Reviews.Author: starrbooss
Reviews.Content: this hotel was ok but i ve stopped in cheaper ,better quality hotels with friendlier staff , the carpets look like someone has shite on there shoes and walked all over the carpets ,the smell of smoke is bad through the day ,but on a night the smoke smells of dope so if you are healthy like me dont go as you find yourself complaining none stop (will be good to get the smoking ban in like they have in england )the food is rubish ,dont bother go and pay at a nice cafe for food.i would go back to amsterdam but only with the smoking ban in place , i dont mind people smoking as long as they do it in there own homes or smoking only places which dont subject non smokers to there filthy habbit.a lot of people who come to amsterdam are horrible dope smokers , and you can spot them a mile of , similar to what glue sniffers looked like out off the eighties-thick as [--]. its a lovely city but spoiled by these people who come here to get stoned (shallow ,shallow people.) what ever happened to seeing the sights , a little culture , have a nice meal and a good drink like a propper bloke.........

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyjeanbug
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel at the airport last minute. We chose it for it's proximity to the train station, canal and the sleek stylish modern decor. Unfortunatly the carpets were ridden with stains and the halls smelled of smoke, and at night the smell was so strong I felt like I was sleeping in an ashtray. Not sure if it came from other rooms or the person working in the lobby with his friends. Another down fall is that it is off a red light street and as a result I found myself walking among drunk, obsence men. It seems like it's a party hotel which is not what i'm interested in. It did provide me with adequate basics, and if it could maintain some cleaniless I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good location..”
Reviews.Author: katiemayers
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is good, around a 5 minute walk to the shops and dam sqaure and 10 minutes to the red light district!! theres also a great little coffee shop write next door if you'r into that sort of thing,however if the 'coffee shops' are not your bag its a very low key tastefully decorated one. When we made our booking over the internet,it asked me to state whether i wanted a twin/double room, i stated clearly that i wanted a double room also adding a remark asking for them to ensure we got this. However on arrival, we where givin a twin room. When we requested to swop the room to a double like was asked for the staff did try to accomodate us due to an error made,but said there where non available, and to try again tomorrow between 2-3pm, which as we where only there for two days was abit of an annoyance. As middle ground they offeredto swop the twin room on the third floor,to a canal view twin with no extra cost. The 'canal' view room was on the first floor 052 to be precise right in front of reception, The room although bigger than the first was very noisey and the view we where promised as a substitute was non exsistant as the windows where very high up and over looked a stair case and people legs and feet sat outside the coffee shop. The 2nd day saw no success with the double room and as we complained about the noise they offered to move us back upto the third floor, which we declined because the original room was small. The rooms are unique,but quite basic. The bathroom was quite nice,and had a very good shower. The beds where very comfortable but small. They provide you however with a safe which is very handy. On departure they gave took 30 euros off the total for our stay which seemed quite fair. The staff where polite, allthough some of the younger ones seemed a little uneducated about the hotel system.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny rooms, but great location”
Reviews.Author: JS272
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were at The Times Hotel over the weekend. It is excellently located on a quiet residential street near the train station, flower market, shopping district, etc. Sadly, the location is the hotel's best, if not only attribute. We arrived on a Fri night to find that they booked our reservation in their computer for July, not June. Altho they had a room free for that night, they didnt for the next night. SO THEY WERE GOING TO SEND THEIR NEXT GUEST SOMEWHERE ELSE. We had two rooms on Fri night. One of them was in the attic. DO NOT GET THIS ROOM. it was roughly 300 sq ft, with a pitched roof. two adults could not walk past each other. the other room was on the first floor and was a quad, with two beds on one level and two beds on a loft level. it was more comfortable, altho it lacked anywhere to sit (aside from the bed). both rooms faced the canal (at an extra charge) with lovely views. The second night, all 4 of us crammed into one room, which was ok (but no privacy). Finally, the beds are awful - soft and adorned w polyester sheets. For 200 EUR a night, i expected at least a good night's rest. To the hotel's credit, the front desk crew were nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, great view, weird bathroom, cleanliness was a ??, red light area”
Reviews.Author: snitter
Reviews.Content: We were unhappy with our other hotel in Amsterdam, so we saw this while walking around. The guy at the desk showed us a "sample" room---which was above the area served by the elevators so we wouldn't have wanted it. But, it was spacious and had a luggage rack and chair. When we checked in we were given a tiny room--there was maybe 2 feet clearance on each side of the beds--2 twin beds pushed together. There was NO shower curtain or enclosure, which I have heard of in other hotels. The procedure seemed to be to shower, then use your smaller towel as a bath mat and to mop up the water you got on the floor. Breakfast was separate, and 10 euros each, so we walked out and got pastries or tea. Yes, there WAS air conditioning, which worked well. The white cotton cover on my comforter smelled sour and may not have been that clean. It was not changed during our 3 days there....

Reviews.Title: “A good experience, make sure to have a canal view room”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBrighton
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel. We were able to walk there from the train station. The hotel is situated on Herengracht and is in a fantastic location, not far from Dam Square. When we arrived the staff were friendly but we were told a canal view room (which we had reserved online) was not available. We were offered a different room (at a cheaper rate) for the first night and then moved to a canal view room for the next 2 nights. The first room was small, but clean, and the twin beds were comfortable. The bathroom was modern with good toiletries provided. One wall was decorated with a large Van Gogh painting printed on the wall. The window looks onto the middle of the building, so there is not exactly a great view. The only problem we had with this room was that the blinds did not work when we came to close them. The member of staff on the desk tried to help but in the end we had to untie the strings on the blind so that the window was covered, which meant we couldn't open it in the morning. We moved to our second room with the minimum of fuss, this was a great room on the top floor, also quite small, but as expected in an old canal house. The room is built into the roof of the canal house so is quite an unusual shape, in a good way! There are 3 windows in total making it nice and light. The room also had a large Van Gogh print on one wall. This room had a double bed, and a great view from the window over the canal, and had a good bathroom too. There was plenty of space for storing clothes etc. and there is a safe to keep your valubles in. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. On our last day the hotel let us keep our bags in a locked cupboard by reception after check out, allowing us to go out and enjoy our last morning and pick up our bags on our way back to the train station. Overall it was a good experience, the canal view room is a good choice. There is a member of staff on the desk 24 hours in case you need anything, and they all spoke good English. As far as facilities go it is pretty basic e.g. no tea/coffee in rooms, but the bathrooms are great and have lots of nice toiletries to use.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable service”
Reviews.Author: kodachromeberlin
Reviews.Content: the rooms are nicely done (new renovation), but that's about it: - service people at hotel are completely unknowledgeable, they must be students who have not been properly trained - this is where the hotel has a real problem. they don't know how to print a proper bill, etc..and are unfriendly and harsh on top, preferring to smoke in the lobby lounge instead of giving good service - no WLAN in rooms - the rooms are TINY

Reviews.Title: “Great quirky hotel with lovely service”
Reviews.Author: killerjules
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at the Times Hotel in a canal room on the top floor. The room was built into the roof, so tall people would have to duck under some of the beams, but at 5'3" i had no problems! (My boyfriend is 6 ft and there was only the beam by the front door that he had to duck under, but the room was big enough that you didn't need to go near it again!) Painted blue, with a print on one of the walls, the room was kinda quirky. It was quite spacious, with a cute bathroom which was clean and modern. Fresh towels were provided each day, but the rooms were not tidied during our stay. The front desk was always friendly, and its 24 hours, which gives you peace of mind. There are wi-fi internet facilities in the hotel, however I didn't have my laptop with me, so they let me use their computer to check into my flight! Didn't try the breakfast in the hotel, although it looked good, but wanted to get out and about so didn't try it out. Its an additional â‚¬10 for breakfast. We paid â‚¬427 for the 3 night stay. It wasn't cheap, but it was good quality, in a good location with friendly service. I would stay again, and would definitely recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Grossly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Morrisse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Times Hotel in November '06 while visiting a trade fair in Amsterdam. I booked on the internet and was happy with my choice of hotel having read the reviews, I had a canal view room costing 200 euro per night. The reception is tiny and includes the few small tables at which breakfast is served. The bedroom was clean and reasonably spacious but street noise ensured a very early morning call. The decor was minimalist, bed was comfartable and bathroom ok. There were no other facilities as far as I could see. I didnt have breakfast which was not included in the bill. On paying my bill for 210 euro approx I felt I had been ripped off, this is not a 200 euro a night hotel and the experience left a bad taste on what otherwise was a very enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quirky decor!”
Reviews.Author: creid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Times for 3 nights, had a room on the 3rd floor facing the canal so lovely view. The room was very unusually decorated with 1 wall completely covered with some form of 17th - 18th century painting (wallpaper) - fantastic! The beds were very comfortable, bathroom very clean and modern. There were a few cigarette burns on the carpet but overall the room was clean. Good location, only 5 minute walk from Dam square and friendly staff on reception all hours. There is also a very small but very nice coffee shop about 100m down the street - good way to end a day of sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “great stylish hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: yvtravels
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel. its very stylish and has a great atmosphere. the location is amazing. within walking distance to everything. if you arrive by train and have luggage, i would not walk thru the tiny streets with suitcases. hop in a taxi for 5 -7 euros. we can highly recommend this place to anyone and would stay there in a heartbeat again. there are cute outdoor cafes everywhere, so i would not have bfast at the hotel. there is also a coffeeshop right next door. the area appeared to be very safe, even though they have a tiny red light street around the corner. the rooms are small, and the walls are very thin. one morning they forgot to give us a wake up call (so bring your alarm clock) but the maid next door woke us up. the bathrooms are great. and every room has a special painting on the wall. if you are in a'dam on a sunday in the summer time, do NOT miss out on going to the beach close to zandvoort (there are trains + busses from amsterdam maybe 30mins - just ask for zandvoort ). if you love cool beach parties/lounges, you will really like the stylish bars/lounges they have there. e.g .(--). they offer food and drinks everywhere. we got there around 730pm and people were still partying from the morning hours.

Reviews.Title: “smallest room I have ever stayed in, in 40 years of travel”
Reviews.Author: ottawacitizen
Reviews.Content: First the good news. The hotel is well located and has fantastic bathrooms. The staff is generally helpful. The place is very clean(and should be for a brand new hotel). Now the bad news. The room was so small that there was no place even to put a telephone (it was left on the floor) and had walls right next to BOTH sides of the very comfortable bed. If anyone had dropped something on either side of the bed, it would have required a crane or major piece of work to remove the bed so that the item could be recovered. We complained that this teensy room should never have been assgined to a couple and was certainly not worth the 200 euros charged and that we had to crawl out the back of the bed to get out of it and had no place to put our luggage without partially blocking either the entry to the room or the bathroom. To their credit, our rate was reduced to 140 euros, which was stilll expensive for a space that was so tiny, They also offered to change our room the second night, but by then we were leaving the next morning. So if you stay here, do check to see first what size room you are being offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayeleta
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-nights weekend in Amsterdam, where we stayed in The Times hotel. We went there because is was just remodeled and had a good price. We really enjoyed the stay. The hotel's location on the Herengracht canal is great! it's quiet since no tram or bus are traveling there, and it's a 5-minute walk to the center, the Jordaan area, Anne Frank's museum, and to the central station. The room was remodeled in a good taste (loved the shower). We recommend it and would definitely return if in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ans206
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice and I loved it. Rooms are clean, new and modern. The one with the 'Nachtwacht' /' Nightwatch' painting on the wall is very special. The rooms are not really large but that doesn't matter cause it is a real hotel for tourist and not so much for business travellers. The Staff is very friendly and it is located in my favorite part of Amsterdam on the Herengracht. This where you can see and experience Amsterdam at it's best.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant cosy hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: CheekyNomad
Reviews.Content: Excellent find. Hotel only just opened after refurbishment, hence we had a great rate for the room. Room itself was small but of a very good standard, cosy, and a really nice bathroom. Staff extremely friendly and accomodating. Excellent location in the canal area, walking distance to everything.

HotelInfo.Name: The Times Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Herengracht 137, Amsterdam 1015 BG, The Netherlands
